FuncDef:
The service-policy name command creates a value-added service policy template and enters the value-added service policy view.
The undo service-policy name command deletes a value-added service policy template.
By default, no value-added service policy is created.
CLIs: undo service-policy name <policy-name> [ portal | edsg | mirror ]

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates an enhanced dynamic service gateway (EDSG) service policy.
-

Specifies the name of a value-added service policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-insensitive characters, which can be uppercase letters A to Z, lowercase letters a to z, digits 0 to 9, periods (.), hyphens (-), underscores (_), or their combinations.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure a service policy template, run the service-policy command. The services include EDSG and portal services. The EDSG service integrates multiple services, and the portal service forcibly directs users to a specified web page after the users log in to a device.
Precautions
A value-added service policy template must have a unique name on a device. Value-added service policy templates can define the same service type.
The maximum capacity allowed for a service policy template is 4096.
